column4: I was installing VirtualBox 2.1 when my connection to my wireless network was lost for some reason. After that, and since rebooting, I can't see any wireless networks. Help?
-> sudo iwlist wlan0 scan   any output?
wlan0       Interface doesn't support scanning: Network is down
-> is that your wifi nic name? or is it ath0?   sudo lshw -C network
It looks like it might be called wmaster0
-> your drive is not loaded, reload it please
Trying that.
I disabled it, rebooted, then enabled it, then rebooted. Still nothing.
-> what did you disable?
-> how did you enable it?
-> when you do  lsmod |grep thatdrivername   any results ?    use modprobe perhaps?
By the way, with the sudo lshw -C network command, next to the wireless section it says *=network DISABLED
-> can you post the results in pastebin of sudo lshw -C network
Sure, gimmie a minute. Gotta copy/paste it between machines.
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/108047/
-> try to enable it? isnt there like a box you click with network manager?
nm-applet shows that wireless IS enabled
-> not from what you pasted..but try   sudo ifdown ath0  then sudo ifup ath0
ifdown: interface ath0 not configured
-> use the nic name assigned to it, it could have been wlan0, eth0
Nope, didn't work still. :-(
-> http://www.ubuntuaone.com/content/intrepid-update-breaks-ath5k
